titles.title: Campaign Spending Limitation Reform Act of 1996
To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide for campaign spending limits, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Oversight.

bill.summary: 06/13/1996--Introduced. Campaign Spending Limitation Reform Act of 1996 - Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to set forth limitations on campaign spending for elections to the Senate and House of Representatives. Prohibits a national or State political party committee from making expenditures with respect to an election for either the office of Senator or Representative. Limits the amount of contributions a local political party may make to candidates for such offices to $100 per office. Sets forth penalties for exceeding the above spending limitations. Prohibits the use of soft money or contributions in kind with respect to a Senate or House election and establishes criminal penalties for violators.
